factText: Glad to have you on campus!
This game is REALLY fun!
Go Red Raiders!
We definitely need more facts!
Merlin is a great wizard - you should search for her
Have you ever heard of the rubber duck debugging method?
Did you know a rubber duck is only 20 doubloons in the shop
Stuck on a problem? Talk it out with a trusty rubber ducky!!
Welcome to the Shippensburg University campus.
Make sure to logout when you are done working.
You should go check out MCT!
If you walk down Shippen hall is where you'll be.
If you walk down the right path you'll find Franklin Science center.
The library and the cub are towards the top right of this area, go explore!!
There's another teleporter somewhere around here, go explore!!
Have any questions?
Hello there! Hope you're having a good semester!
I'm the president and very cool.
Ship was founded in 1871 as a "normal school" which means it was a school for teaching people to be teachers
In 1982, when the governor signed Senate Bill 506, we became Shippensburg University.
In 1926, we became the first normal school in PA to be chartered as a state teachers college.
We became the first teachers college in PA to be accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education.
Our students come from across the Commonwealth, 20 states, and 15 countries.
Ship awards $79,000,000 annually in grants, scholarships, student employment, and loans
Our campus covers 210 acres
Over 2,000 employers a year come looking to hire our students.

Ada Lovelace ( 1815 - 1852 ) is credited with being the first computer scientist because she was able to see that Charles Babbage's plans for a computing machine could be used for more than basic math calculations.
I attended The George Washington University in Washington, DC for all three degrees.
The word cookies comes from koekje, a Dutch word meaning ‘little cakes.’ The first cookies were made with scraps of pie crust or drops of extra cake batter.
Cheesecakes date back to Roman times, when mild, milky cheeses got a jolt of sweetness from honey.

The oldest knitted artifacts are socks from Egypt, dating from the 11th century. They are a very fine gauge, done with complex colorwork and some have a short row heel, which necessitates the purl stitch. These complexities suggest that knitting is even older than the archeological record can prove.
A person burns 55 calories by knitting for half an hour.
I've been playing tabletop role playing games with the same group of friends since 2000.
I didn't learn to code until I was a freshman in college.
At one time, I was going to be an International Business major.
I think the funniest animal is a tarsier. It's somewhere between a lemur and a monkey. Seriously, they're hilarious. Go look them up.
SU was originally founded as the Cumberland Valley State Normal School.
Until the 1960s, students and faculty still lived in Old Main.
The school only had 6 faculty and 217 students when it opened in 1873.
McCune Hall became the first co-ed dorm in 1974.
Due to the wartime draft, in 1944-45 the campus only had women's athletic teams.
The African American Organization (Afro Am) began in 1970.
The campus newspaper, The Slate, was founded in 1957.
Until the 1970s, new students wore a 'dink' hat during their first semester.
Anthony 'Tony' Ceddia was SU's longest president (24 years).
SU XC Coach Steve Spence competed in the 1991 Olympics in Tokyo, Japan.
Stewart Hall was the campus's first gym and student union.
In 1968, students helped move 75,000 books to the new Ezra Lehman Library.
Before 1960, the school only granted teaching degrees.
In 1873-74, the school required all students to take a bath once a week.
